id: An account holder is named on the account and is authorized to conduct transactions associated with the account. Authorization is typically evidenced by signatures maintained on file by the account provider.
name: An account holder is named on the account and is authorized to conduct transactions associated with the account. Authorization is typically evidenced by signatures maintained on file by the account provider.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: identifier that uniquely identifies the financial institution and, when appropriate, the branch of that financial institution servicing an account
name: identifier that uniquely identifies the financial institution and, when appropriate, the branch of that financial institution servicing an account

id: indicates the account to which the transaction record or individual transaction applies
name: indicates the account to which the transaction record or individual transaction applies

id: any deposit account that is not explicitly considered a transaction account
name: any deposit account that is not explicitly considered a transaction account

id: relates an account statement to the amount of money available in that account at the beginning of the statement period
name: relates an account statement to the amount of money available in that account at the beginning of the statement period

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to link a credit agreement with an account and loosen transaction-related constraints such that the notion of a transaction can be applied to credit agreements generally.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to link a credit agreement with an account and loosen transaction-related constraints such that the notion of a transaction can be applied to credit agreements generally.

id: financial asset in the form of an account
name: financial asset in the form of an account

id: unique identifier for record of transactions
name: unique identifier for record of transactions

id: corporate officer that has overarching responsibility for the relationship with a specific borrower or account
name: corporate officer that has overarching responsibility for the relationship with a specific borrower or account

id: time deposit account that allows deposits (other than time certificates of deposit) for which there is in force a written contract with the depositor that neither the whole nor any part of such deposit may be withdrawn prior to (1) the date of maturity, which shall be not less than seven days after the date of the deposit, or (2) the expiration of a specified period of written notice of not less than seven days
name: time deposit account that allows deposits (other than time certificates of deposit) for which there is in force a written contract with the depositor that neither the whole nor any part of such deposit may be withdrawn prior to (1) the date of maturity, which shall be not less than seven days after the date of the deposit, or (2) the expiration of a specified period of written notice of not less than seven days

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to rename ownership related properties for consistent alignment with the ownership situational pattern.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to rename ownership related properties for consistent alignment with the ownership situational pattern.

id: ), which is the ISO registrar for ISO 13616.
name: ), which is the ISO registrar for ISO 13616.

id: identifier for a bank account that is an expanded version of the basic bank account number (BBAN), intended for use internationally
name: identifier for a bank account that is an expanded version of the basic bank account number (BBAN), intended for use internationally

id: amount of money available or owed
name: amount of money available or owed

id: Customers of financial service providers frequently hold multiple accounts - brokerage accounts, checking and savings accounts, trust accounts, and so forth - which may have specific terms and conditions associated with them.
name: Customers of financial service providers frequently hold multiple accounts - brokerage accounts, checking and savings accounts, trust accounts, and so forth - which may have specific terms and conditions associated with them.

id: Examples include operating lines of credit and term loans for property, plant and equipment (PP&E).
name: Examples include operating lines of credit and term loans for property, plant and equipment (PP&E).

id: The date a particular transaction record is closed typically corresponds to (and may precede) the date the account is closed, though in the case of certain accounts, such as a credit card account, if a customer is issued a new account or card number due to loss, fraud, or for some other reason, it is possible that multiple transaction records would be associated with the account. In that case, the close date might correspond to the date that a hold was placed on the original account.
name: The date a particular transaction record is closed typically corresponds to (and may precede) the date the account is closed, though in the case of certain accounts, such as a credit card account, if a customer is issued a new account or card number due to loss, fraud, or for some other reason, it is possible that multiple transaction records would be associated with the account. In that case, the close date might correspond to the date that a hold was placed on the original account.

id: account associated with a product or service that requires the account holder to provide funds for management by the account provider
name: account associated with a product or service that requires the account holder to provide funds for management by the account provider

id: cash instrument associated with a time deposit account that cannot be withdrawn for a certain period of time (term)
name: cash instrument associated with a time deposit account that cannot be withdrawn for a certain period of time (term)

id: Common kinds of account statements include checking account statements, usually provided monthly, and brokerage account statements, which are provided monthly or quarterly, depending on the terms of the account agreement. Monthly credit card bills are also considered account statements.
name: Common kinds of account statements include checking account statements, usually provided monthly, and brokerage account statements, which are provided monthly or quarterly, depending on the terms of the account agreement. Monthly credit card bills are also considered account statements.

id: party that owns a customer account
name: party that owns a customer account

id: provides a textual description of the transaction
name: provides a textual description of the transaction

id: time deposit account that allows deposits evidenced by a negotiable or nonnegotiable instrument, or a deposit in book entry form evidenced by a receipt or similar acknowledgement issued by the bank, that provides, on its face, that the amount of such deposit is payable to the bearer, to any specified person, or to the order of a specified person, as follows: (1) on a certain date not less than seven days after the date of deposit, (2) at the expiration of a specified period not less than seven days after the date of the deposit, or (3) upon written notice to the bank which is to be given not less than seven days before the date of withdrawal.
name: time deposit account that allows deposits evidenced by a negotiable or nonnegotiable instrument, or a deposit in book entry form evidenced by a receipt or similar acknowledgement issued by the bank, that provides, on its face, that the amount of such deposit is payable to the bearer, to any specified person, or to the order of a specified person, as follows: (1) on a certain date not less than seven days after the date of deposit, (2) at the expiration of a specified period not less than seven days after the date of the deposit, or (3) upon written notice to the bank which is to be given not less than seven days before the date of withdrawal.

id: date on which something was closed
name: date on which something was closed

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to change a property on CertificateOfDeposit from has notional amount to has nominal value for the sake of consistency.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to change a property on CertificateOfDeposit from has notional amount to has nominal value for the sake of consistency.

id: indicates the date by which payment of some amount must be made to the creditor
name: indicates the date by which payment of some amount must be made to the creditor

id: account recorded in a general ledger
name: account recorded in a general ledger

id: relates something to the date that it was closed
name: relates something to the date that it was closed

id: identifier for an individual transaction associated with an account
name: identifier for an individual transaction associated with an account

id: relates an account to a client or customer that is considered a secondary, co-owner of the account
name: relates an account to a client or customer that is considered a secondary, co-owner of the account

id: account that represents an identified, named collection of balances and cumulative totals used to summarize customer transaction-related activity over a designated period of time
name: account that represents an identified, named collection of balances and cumulative totals used to summarize customer transaction-related activity over a designated period of time

id: service-agreement that is account-specific, applicable in cases where a client might hold multiple accounts with differing terms and conditions
name: service-agreement that is account-specific, applicable in cases where a client might hold multiple accounts with differing terms and conditions

id: or securities held at a financial institution
name: or securities held at a financial institution

id: account associated with a service in which the account holder receives funds from the account provider under certain terms and conditions for repayment
name: account associated with a service in which the account holder receives funds from the account provider under certain terms and conditions for repayment

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate the disjointness between a deposit account and investment account to allow for certain portfolio management accounts that have characteristics of both.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate the disjointness between a deposit account and investment account to allow for certain portfolio management accounts that have characteristics of both.

id: party that provides and services an account
name: party that provides and services an account

id: relates something to the date that it was created
name: relates something to the date that it was created

id: date by which payment of the current outstanding balance, part thereof, or a minimum amount due must be made to the creditor
name: date by which payment of the current outstanding balance, part thereof, or a minimum amount due must be made to the creditor

id: date on which something was created
name: date on which something was created

id: identifier that uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution in a particular country and which includes a bank identifier of the financial institution servicing that account
name: identifier that uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution in a particular country and which includes a bank identifier of the financial institution servicing that account

id: second-level classifier for a transaction, e.g., direct deposit, check, cash advance, withdrawal, payment, purchase, and so forth
name: second-level classifier for a transaction, e.g., direct deposit, check, cash advance, withdrawal, payment, purchase, and so forth

id: Deposit accounts include savings accounts, money market accounts, and transactional accounts, such as demand deposit accounts, among others.
name: Deposit accounts include savings accounts, money market accounts, and transactional accounts, such as demand deposit accounts, among others.

id: date that determines in which posting period a document or journal entry is added to an account record
name: date that determines in which posting period a document or journal entry is added to an account record

id: container for records associated with a business arrangement for regular transactions and services
name: container for records associated with a business arrangement for regular transactions and services

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add definitions for transaction records, which are needed to represent statements of various sorts, to add the concept of an account statement, and to clean up and augment definitions related to accounts, account holders, etc. as required for the purpose of representing credit card accounts.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add definitions for transaction records, which are needed to represent statements of various sorts, to add the concept of an account statement, and to clean up and augment definitions related to accounts, account holders, etc. as required for the purpose of representing credit card accounts.

id: The typical objectives of an investment account are to achieve long term growth, income or capital preservation from the deposited asset portfolio. Investment accounts are typically not insured.
name: The typical objectives of an investment account are to achieve long term growth, income or capital preservation from the deposited asset portfolio. Investment accounts are typically not insured.

id: identifier that identifies a demand deposit account provided by a bank
name: identifier that identifies a demand deposit account provided by a bank

id: indicates the date on which the transaction actually occurred
name: indicates the date on which the transaction actually occurred

id: Note that this concept of account holder applies to internal accounts that are non-general ledger accounts also have account holders, such as payroll accounts, internal checking accounts associated with cashier's checks, and so forth.
name: Note that this concept of account holder applies to internal accounts that are non-general ledger accounts also have account holders, such as payroll accounts, internal checking accounts associated with cashier's checks, and so forth.

id: The account holder has the right to withdraw deposited funds, as set forth in the terms and conditions governing the account agreement. Deposit accounts may be insured up to a certain amount, depending on the jurisdiction.
name: The account holder has the right to withdraw deposited funds, as set forth in the terms and conditions governing the account agreement. Deposit accounts may be insured up to a certain amount, depending on the jurisdiction.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clean up dead links and address text formatting hygiene issues.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clean up dead links and address text formatting hygiene issues.

id: relates an account statement to the amount of money available in that account at the end of the statement period
name: relates an account statement to the amount of money available in that account at the end of the statement period

id: event recognized by an entry in the records of an account
name: event recognized by an entry in the records of an account

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace additional concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace additional concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.

id: transferable instruments, payment orders of withdrawal, telephone transfers, and so forth, and that may be accessible via an electronic device such as an automated teller machine (ATM), remote service unit (RSU), mobile device, and by debit card
name: transferable instruments, payment orders of withdrawal, telephone transfers, and so forth, and that may be accessible via an electronic device such as an automated teller machine (ATM), remote service unit (RSU), mobile device, and by debit card

id: account close date, transaction record close date, and so forth
name: account close date, transaction record close date, and so forth

id: This ontology provides basic concepts such as account, account holder, account provider, relationship manager that are commonly used by financial services providers to describe customers and to determine counterparty identities.
name: This ontology provides basic concepts such as account, account holder, account provider, relationship manager that are commonly used by financial services providers to describe customers and to determine counterparty identities.

id: non-interest-bearing deposit account in which deposits are payable immediately on demand, or that are issued with an original maturity or required notice period of less than seven days, or that represent funds for which the depository institution does not reserve the right to require at least seven days' written notice of an intended withdrawal
name: non-interest-bearing deposit account in which deposits are payable immediately on demand, or that are issued with an original maturity or required notice period of less than seven days, or that represent funds for which the depository institution does not reserve the right to require at least seven days' written notice of an intended withdrawal

id: connects a given customer account to another customer account
name: connects a given customer account to another customer account

id: event that has a monetary impact and is documented in the records associated with an account
name: event that has a monetary impact and is documented in the records associated with an account

id: indicates the date that the transaction was posted to the account
name: indicates the date that the transaction was posted to the account

id: version of this ontology was modified to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.
name: version of this ontology was modified to replace hasDefinition with isDefinedIn to clarify intent.

id: high-level classifier for an individual transaction
name: high-level classifier for an individual transaction

id: version of this ontology was modified to support the addition of maturity-related properties to financial instruments.
name: version of this ontology was modified to support the addition of maturity-related properties to financial instruments.

id: The account holder may or may not be entitled to consideration in exchange for providing such funds, for example, interest, depending on the type of account and the terms and conditions associated with it. Also, there may be fees associated with management services provided by the account provider. Note too that this may be an internal account held on behalf of an institution or a customer account.
name: The account holder may or may not be entitled to consideration in exchange for providing such funds, for example, interest, depending on the type of account and the terms and conditions associated with it. Also, there may be fees associated with management services provided by the account provider. Note too that this may be an internal account held on behalf of an institution or a customer account.

id: Note that this may be an internal account held on behalf of an institution or a customer account, such as a line of credit account associated with an internal line of business.
name: Note that this may be an internal account held on behalf of an institution or a customer account, such as a line of credit account associated with an internal line of business.

id: Excluded from transaction accounts are savings deposits (both money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) and other savings deposits), even though such deposits permit some third-party transfers. However, an account that otherwise meets the definition of a savings deposit but that authorizes or permits the depositor to exceed the transfer limitations specified for that account shall be reported as a transaction account.
name: Excluded from transaction accounts are savings deposits (both money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) and other savings deposits), even though such deposits permit some third-party transfers. However, an account that otherwise meets the definition of a savings deposit but that authorizes or permits the depositor to exceed the transfer limitations specified for that account shall be reported as a transaction account.

id: A time deposit from which partial early withdrawals are permitted must impose additional early withdrawal penalties of at least seven days' simple interest on amounts withdrawn within six days after each partial withdrawal. If such additional early withdrawal penalties are not imposed, the account ceases to be a time deposit. The account may become a savings deposit if it meets the requirements for a savings deposit; otherwise it becomes a demand deposit.
name: A time deposit from which partial early withdrawals are permitted must impose additional early withdrawal penalties of at least seven days' simple interest on amounts withdrawn within six days after each partial withdrawal. If such additional early withdrawal penalties are not imposed, the account ceases to be a time deposit. The account may become a savings deposit if it meets the requirements for a savings deposit; otherwise it becomes a demand deposit.

id: periodic summary of account activity for a given period of time
name: periodic summary of account activity for a given period of time

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clarify and extend definitions related to non-bank financial institutions.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to clarify and extend definitions related to non-bank financial institutions.

id: relates an account to the net amount of money available in that account
name: relates an account to the net amount of money available in that account

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.

id: indicates the status of the transaction record
name: indicates the status of the transaction record

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of certain organization-specific concepts from BE to FND, to incorporate the concept of a composite identifier for BBAN and IBAN definition, loosen the definition of bank identifier with respect to the nature of the functional entity it identifies, and clarify the identifier hierarchy and fix spelling.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of certain organization-specific concepts from BE to FND, to incorporate the concept of a composite identifier for BBAN and IBAN definition, loosen the definition of bank identifier with respect to the nature of the functional entity it identifies, and clarify the identifier hierarchy and fix spelling.

id: For an account in Switzerland, suppose that an example domestic account number is 762 1162-3852.957. Suppose further that the bank identifier portion of that domestic account number is 762, or normalized for the BBAN is '00762'. For that example, the corresponding BBAN is '00762011623852957' and IBAN is 'CH9300762011623852957'.
name: For an account in Switzerland, suppose that an example domestic account number is 762 1162-3852.957. Suppose further that the bank identifier portion of that domestic account number is 762, or normalized for the BBAN is '00762'. For that example, the corresponding BBAN is '00762011623852957' and IBAN is 'CH9300762011623852957'.

id: account offered by a broker that allows the investor to deposit funds and place investment orders
name: account offered by a broker that allows the investor to deposit funds and place investment orders

id: indicates the merchant (seller) involved in the transaction
name: indicates the merchant (seller) involved in the transaction

id: The balance is the net amount after factoring in all debits and credits, including service charges and fees.
name: The balance is the net amount after factoring in all debits and credits, including service charges and fees.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of hasTerm from FinancialInstruments to Contracts and add the definition of a lending officer.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the move of hasTerm from FinancialInstruments to Contracts and add the definition of a lending officer.

id: date on which a specific transaction was initiated
name: date on which a specific transaction was initiated

id: Non-transaction accounts include: (a) savings deposits ((i) money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) and (ii) other savings deposits) and (b) time deposits ((i) time certificates of deposit and (ii) time deposits, open account).
name: Non-transaction accounts include: (a) savings deposits ((i) money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) and (ii) other savings deposits) and (b) time deposits ((i) time certificates of deposit and (ii) time deposits, open account).

id: relates an account to a client or customer that is considered the primary owner of the account
name: relates an account to a client or customer that is considered the primary owner of the account

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to generalize the definition of customer account and eliminate ambiguity in others.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to generalize the definition of customer account and eliminate ambiguity in others.

id: Note that for many financial institutions, there must be a client or customer designated as the primary owner. In cases where there is a tax identifier associated with the account, it is that of the primary owner.
name: Note that for many financial institutions, there must be a client or customer designated as the primary owner. In cases where there is a tax identifier associated with the account, it is that of the primary owner.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecated elements that were deprecated more than six months ago (FND-386).
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecated elements that were deprecated more than six months ago (FND-386).

id: relates a credit agreement to an account used as the basis for managing transactions
name: relates a credit agreement to an account used as the basis for managing transactions

id: links an account statement to the individual transactions it documents
name: links an account statement to the individual transactions it documents

id: ISO 13616-1:2007 Financial services - International bank account number (IBAN)
name: ISO 13616-1:2007 Financial services - International bank account number (IBAN)

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add definitions for balance, fee, general ledger, ledger account, income and related properties, revise definitions to be ISO 704 compliant, and eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to add definitions for balance, fee, general ledger, ledger account, income and related properties, revise definitions to be ISO 704 compliant, and eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC.

id: account that provides a record of money placed with a depository institution for safekeeping and management
name: account that provides a record of money placed with a depository institution for safekeeping and management

id: service involving the extension of credit to support business activities
name: service involving the extension of credit to support business activities

id: record of transactions associated with an account
name: record of transactions associated with an account

id: responsible party who manages a client's account and oversees their relationship with the service provider
name: responsible party who manages a client's account and oversees their relationship with the service provider

id: When the term is over it can be withdrawn or it can be held for another term. The longer the term the better the yield on the money.
name: When the term is over it can be withdrawn or it can be held for another term. The longer the term the better the yield on the money.

id: Demand deposits include any matured time deposits without automatic renewal provisions, unless the deposit agreement provides for the funds to be transferred at maturity to another type of account. Demand deposits do not include: (i) money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) or (ii) NOW accounts.
name: Demand deposits include any matured time deposits without automatic renewal provisions, unless the deposit agreement provides for the funds to be transferred at maturity to another type of account. Demand deposits do not include: (i) money market deposit accounts (MMDAs) or (ii) NOW accounts.

id: accounting record summarizing changes in position as transactions are posted during an accounting period
name: accounting record summarizing changes in position as transactions are posted during an accounting period

id: The investor owns the assets contained in the brokerage account and must usually claim as income any capital gains incurred.
name: The investor owns the assets contained in the brokerage account and must usually claim as income any capital gains incurred.

id: deposit account that the depositor does not have a right, and is not permitted, to make withdrawals from within six days after the date of deposit unless the deposit is subject to an early withdrawal penalty of at least seven days' simple interest on amounts withdrawn within the first six days after deposit
name: deposit account that the depositor does not have a right, and is not permitted, to make withdrawals from within six days after the date of deposit unless the deposit is subject to an early withdrawal penalty of at least seven days' simple interest on amounts withdrawn within the first six days after deposit

id: In general, an account is associated with a contractual relationship between a buyer and seller under which payment may be made at a later time. General ledger accounts are an exception to this, however, and typically do not have account holders, including internal account holders. They may, on the other hand, have responsible parties.
name: In general, an account is associated with a contractual relationship between a buyer and seller under which payment may be made at a later time. General ledger accounts are an exception to this, however, and typically do not have account holders, including internal account holders. They may, on the other hand, have responsible parties.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised per the FIBO 2.0 RFC with respect to the definitions for accounts and account identifiers, such as BBAN and IBAN identifiers, including but not limited to bank accounts.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised per the FIBO 2.0 RFC with respect to the definitions for accounts and account identifiers, such as BBAN and IBAN identifiers, including but not limited to bank accounts.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate deprecated elements.
name: ClientsAndAccounts.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate deprecated elements.
